newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhstan cancels Embamunaigaz oil concern tender.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhstan cancels Embamunaigaz oil concern tender.

text.p: Kazakhstan has cancelled a tender to sell a 60 percent stake in Embamunaigaz, the country's fourth largest oil and gas enterprise, a Kazakh privatisation official said on Monday.
"The owner -- the state -- has withdrawn its order to sell the shares," a senior official at the finance ministry's privatisation department told Reuters.
He gave no reason for the decision.
The tender was announced only last week, and was part of the former Soviet republic's fast-track privatisation programme for its ailing but rich oil and gas sector.

Nurlan Balgimbayev, the head of newly formed Kazakh Oil, a state-owned company which replaced the country's oil and gas ministry, expressed surprise last week at the tender announcement and said the sale of strategic shares in oil enterprises now lay with his organisation.
Kazakhstan's oil barons and the government have sparred in recent months over the pace of privatisation.
Embamunaigaz produced 1.74 million tonnes (34,800 barrels per day) of crude in 1996 and sits on an estimated 65.7 million tonnes (486.1 million barrels) of reserves.
